result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob David Katona was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not be present in establishments whose primary purpose is the sale/serving of alcohol.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with P.G.K.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and shall complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant Jacob David Katona appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen appeared by video for Jacob David Katona.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Def consents to appearing by video for plea/sentencing.  Case is resolved w/def free to argue.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2; Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Def acknowledges prior conviction.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1.  Argument from State and counsel.  Statements from def.  Court proceeds to sentencing. Postconviction rights sent to counsel via email; to be filed upon obtaining def's signature.  JT set 9-19-22 removed from the calendar.
Jury status hearing on September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Def enters no contest plea.  Court will not accept a no contest plea.  Recess for counsel and def to meet privately in break-out room.  Counsel indicates def wishes to proceed by entering no contest plea; Court will not accept plea.  JT set on 9-19-22 remains as scheduled.
